channel.title: CyberNetSec - Cloud Security
channel.description: Latest cloud security threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Microsoft 'Whisper Leak' Attack Can Spy on Encrypted AI Chats
item.description:
Microsoft researchers have discovered a novel side-channel attack method named 'Whisper Leak' that undermines the privacy of encrypted AI chatbot conversations. By analyzing the size and timing of encrypted data packets from streaming Large Language Models (LLMs), a passive network observer can accu...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Threat Intelligence, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical Container Escape Flaws in runC Threaten Docker & Kubernetes
item.description:
A security alert issued on November 9, 2025, warns of three new critical vulnerabilities in runC, the low-level container runtime used by Docker, Kubernetes, and other major container platforms. The flaws could allow a malicious actor to execute a 'container escape,' breaking out of the isolated con...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Amazon Patches High-Severity Flaw in WorkSpaces Linux Client
item.description:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) has patched a high-severity vulnerability, CVE-2025-12779, in its WorkSpaces client for Linux. The flaw, rated 8.8 CVSS, could allow a local attacker on a shared computer to extract another user's authentication token and gain unauthorized access to their virtual desktop se...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Identity is the New Perimeter: Stolen Credentials and Over-Privileged Accounts Drive Cloud Breaches
item.description:
A consensus is forming across the cybersecurity industry: identity is the new security perimeter in the cloud. New reports from ReliaQuest and Amazon Web Services (AWS) reveal that identity-based attacks are the leading driver of cloud security incidents. Key findings show that compromised credentia...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Cloud Security, Security Operations, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Microsoft Discovers 'SesameOp' Backdoor Using OpenAI API for Covert C2
item.description:
Microsoft's Detection and Response Team (DART) has discovered a novel backdoor named 'SesameOp' that uniquely uses the OpenAI Assistants API for its command-and-control (C2) communications. Found during an espionage investigation, the malware hides its malicious traffic within legitimate API calls t...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Threat Actor, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Finance Execs Targeted in Sophisticated LinkedIn Phishing Scheme with Fake Board Invites
item.description:
A sophisticated phishing campaign is targeting finance executives through LinkedIn direct messages, using fake invitations to an executive board as a lure. The multi-stage attack, detailed by Push Security, aims to harvest Microsoft credentials and session cookies to bypass MFA. The attack chain lev...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Threat Actor, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: EY Leaks 4TB+ SQL Database Packed with Corporate Secrets via Cloud Misconfiguration
item.description:
Consulting giant EY (Ernst & Young) inadvertently exposed a massive, 4TB+ SQL Server backup file to the public internet due to a cloud storage misconfiguration. The unencrypted `.BAK` file, discovered by researchers at Neo Security, contained a treasure trove of highly sensitive internal data, inclu...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Cloud Security, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: "Shadow Escape": New Zero-Click Attack Steals Data from ChatGPT, Claude, and Gemini
item.description:
A novel zero-click attack vector named "Shadow Escape" has been discovered by researchers at Operant, capable of silently exfiltrating sensitive data from popular AI agents like OpenAI's ChatGPT, Anthropic's Claude, and Google's Gemini. The attack exploits the Model Context Protocol (MCP) by embeddi...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Cloud Security, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Massive 70TB Data Leak at Tata Motors from Exposed AWS Keys
item.description:
A colossal security failure at Tata Motors has resulted in the exposure of over 70 terabytes of sensitive corporate data, customer information, and infrastructure details. The breach, which was first identified in 2023, stemmed from multiple critical misconfigurations, including plaintext Amazon Web...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cloud Security, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Massive Breach at Kenyan Health Platform M-TIBA Exposes 4.8 Million Patients
item.description:
A threat actor named 'Kazu' has claimed responsibility for a catastrophic data breach against M-TIBA, a major mobile health platform in Kenya backed by Safaricom. The hacker alleges the theft of 2.15 terabytes of data, impacting up to 4.8 million users. The compromised information reportedly include...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →
